questions.question_body:
Fig. 1.1 shows two strips of staples.
(a) The width of one strip is 56mm.There are 40 staples in the strip. Calculate the average width of one staple.average width of one staple in mm[2]
(b) A student wants to find the volume of one strip of 40 staples. The student has a measuring cylinder and a beaker of water as shown in Fig. 1.2.
Describe how the student can determine the volume of one strip of staples by using the equipment shown in Fig. 1.2.[4]
(c) The staples are made from a block of metal. The mass of the block is 296g. The volume of the block is 33.2cm3.Calculate the density of the metal. Include the unit.[4]

A student has a spring of length 14.0cm. She stretches the spring by adding different loads to the spring.She measures the length of the spring for each load. She plots a graph of the results.Fig. 2.1 shows the graph of her results.
(i) Use the graph to determine the length of the spring when the student adds a load of 8.0N to the spring.[1]
(ii) Use the graph to determine the load added to the spring when the extension of the spring is 7.0cm. [2] 
A load stretching a spring is an example of a force changing the size of an object.[1] 
(c) A clamp stand used in the experiment has a weight of 8.6N. Calculate the mass of the clamp stand.[3]

A student places a book in front of a plane mirror. 
State three characteristics of the image of the book formed by the plane mirror
